trailingComments.value: * Provides symetric encrypt and decrypt via AES.

* This is an excellent way to ensure that all references to Aes can not operate anymore
   * (example: a wallet becomes locked).  An application should ensure there is only one
   * Aes object instance for a given secret `seed`.

leadingComments.value:
* This is an excellent way to ensure that all references to Aes can not operate anymore
   * (example: a wallet becomes locked).  An application should ensure there is only one
   * Aes object instance for a given secret `seed`.

trailingComments.value: * @arg {string} seed - secret seed may be used to encrypt or decrypt.

leadingComments.value: * @arg {string} seed - secret seed may be used to encrypt or decrypt.

trailingComments.value:
* @arg {string} hash - A 128 byte hex string, typically one
   * would call {@link fromSeed} instead.

value.raw: A Sha512 in HEX should be 128 characters long, instead got
value.cooked: A Sha512 in HEX should be 128 characters long, instead got

leadingComments.value:
* @arg {string} hash - A 128 byte hex string, typically one
   * would call {@link fromSeed} instead.

value.raw: A Sha512 Buffer should be 64 characters long, instead got
value.cooked: A Sha512 Buffer should be 64 characters long, instead got

leadingComments.value: Warning: Do not put `nonce = ""` in the arguments, in es6 this will
not convert "null" into an emtpy string
A null or empty string nonce will not effect the hash

extra.rawValue: Invalid key, could not decrypt message(1)

arguments.value: Invalid key, could not decrypt message(1)

extra.rawValue: Invalid key, could not decrypt message(2)

arguments.value: Invalid key, could not decrypt message(2)

trailingComments.value:
* Identical to {@link decrypt_with_checksum} but used to encrypt.  Should not throw an error.
        @return {Buffer} message - Encrypted message which includes a checksum

A null or empty string nonce will not effect the hash

* Provides symetric encrypt and decrypt via AES.

comments.value: * Provides symetric encrypt and decrypt via AES.

* This is an excellent way to ensure that all references to Aes can not operate anymore
   * (example: a wallet becomes locked).  An application should ensure there is only one
   * Aes object instance for a given secret `seed`.
* @arg {string} seed - secret seed may be used to encrypt or decrypt.

* @arg {string} hash - A 128 byte hex string, typically one
   * would call {@link fromSeed} instead.
Warning: Do not put `nonce = ""` in the arguments, in es6 this will
not convert "null" into an emtpy string
A null or empty string nonce will not effect the hash

* Identical to {@link decrypt_with_checksum} but used to encrypt.  Should not throw an error.
        @return {Buffer} message - Encrypted message which includes a checksum
Warning: Do not put `nonce = ""` in the arguments, in es6 this will
not convert "null" into an emtpy string
A null or empty string nonce will not effect the hash
hex is the only common format
hex is the only common format
hex is the only common format
